description:
Part refurbishment/part redevelopment for office  retail
and new market area
as shown on drawing numbers 8512/1101-1111  1120-1125
& 1127-1132 (existing)  8512/2101  2110F  2120G  2130I
2140G  2150G  2160F  2170F  2180F  2190F  2200F  2503C
2504C  2506C  2510B  2511C  2512D & 2513C (proposed)
and 8512/2520A  2521A  2522A  2523  2524A  2525A  2526
2527  2529A  2532  2533A  2535  2536A  2537A  2538 &
2539 (design details)  revised by letters dated 8th
April 1988  23rd June 1988 and 1st August 1988.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The facing materials to be used on the building shall not
    be otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and
    approved by the Council before any work on site is
    commenced.

Condition : 2 - The following details shall not be otherwise than as shall
    Proposed new shopfronts.  (v) Details of the elevation of
    the junctions between the retained  and new building
    elements of the Brooke Street frontage.  (vi) Landscaping
    proposals for the whole site.
    have been submitted to and approved by the Council before
    any work on site is commenced.  (i) Ground floor elevation
    fronting Beauchamp Street including full  details of
    external ventilation grilles (Scale 1:20).  (ii) Details of
    windows, dormer windows and external joinery to a  scale of
    not less than 1:20.  (iii) Details of the proposed rear
    facade including typical details  of new fenestration and
    details of doors and entrance ways  (Scale 1:20).  (iv)

Condition : 3 - The whole of the proposed refurbishment works shall be
    completed to the satisfaction of the local authority and
    English Heritage before any part of the new development is
    brought into use.

Condition : 4 - The total amount of office floorspace shall not exceed 59
    085mz excluding underground plant storage rooms, loading
    area and parking area.

Condition : 5 - The retail areas defined on the submitted plans shall not
    be used for any purpose other than a purpose falling within
    Class A1 of the Schedule of the Town and Country Planning
    (Use Classes) Order 1987.

Condition : 6 - Details of all new plants and air conditioning/ventilation
    equipment shall not be otherwise than as shall have been
    submitted to and approved by the Council before any new
    development work on the site is commenced.

Condition : 7 - No loading or unloading of goods,including fuel, by
    vehicles arriving at or departing from the premises shall
    be carried out otherwise than within the curtilage of the
    building.

Condition : 8 - Details of the provision for access for disabled persons in
    compliance with the provisions of S.4 of the Chronically
    Sick and Disabled Persons Act 1970, and the 1985 Building
    Regulations (as amended by The Building (Disabled People)
    Regulations 1987) shall not be otherwise than as shall have
    been approved by the Council before any work on the site is
    commenced.

Condition : 9 - The developer shall afford access at all reasonable times
    to any archaeologist nominated by the Council and shall
    allow her/him to observe the excavations and record items
    of interest and finds.

Condition : 10 - No works of demolition shall take place until contracts
    have been exchanged for the redevelopment of the site in
    accordance with the scheme for which full planning
    permission has been granted.

Condition : 11 - Full details shall be submitted of the programme of
    development and method statement of building demolition and
    construction and action the developer will undertake to
    ameliorate noise and other nuisances to local
    residents/traders/businesses, during the building programme
    before any work on the site is commenced.

Condition : 12 - No part of the development shall be commenced until such
    time as a phasing programme for the construction of the
    development including the timing of arrangements to the
    highway system including the stopping up of Greville Street
    has been submitted to and approved by the Planning
    Authority.

Condition : 13 - Details of arrangements to be agreed with the local
    authority regarding access to adjoining premises whilst
    development works are undertaken before any work on the
    site is commenced.

Condition : 14 - No works of demolition/construction shall be commenced on
    that part of the site wherein lies Hardwicke House until
    new retail space is available and ready for occupation at
    Dorrington House, Leather Lane.

Condition : 15 - The whole of the car parking accommodation shown on the
    drawings shall be provided and retained permanently for the
    parking of vehicles of the occupiers and users of the
    remainder of the building and together with the services
    areas retained only for these purposes.

Condition : 16 - No part of the newly built development shall be occupied
    until the car parking, vehicle access and all recessing
    highway works have been completed to the satisfaction of
    Highway Authority and the service areas are operational.

Condition : 17 - The "conservatory" area identified on the submitted plans
    on the Beauchamp elevation shall be used only for the
    purposes of an "internal landscaped area" and for no other
    purpose including general office use. New mezzanine floors
    shall not be positioned in this area without first
    obtaining planning permission.

Condition : 18 - Details of the car park and servicing, access and ramps
    shall be submitted to and approved by the Council before
    any work commences on site.

Condition : 19 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building.
Condition : 20 - To ensure the Council may be satisfied with these details.

Condition : 21 - To ensure that the full works of refurbishment are carried
    out as intended.

Condition : 22 - To ensure that the development is completed and occupied as
    permitted.

Condition : 23 - To prevent the unauthorised use of the shop(s) for any of
    the purposes specifically excluded from Class A1 of the
    Schedule of the said Use Classes Order.

Condition : 24 - In order to allow the Council to consider this aspect of
    the development.

Condition : 25 - To avoid obstruction of the surrounding streets and to
    safeguard amenities of adjacent premises.

Condition : 26 - In order to ensure compliance with the terms of the Act and
    Regulations.

Condition : 27 - To ensure that there is an opportunity to investigate this
    site which is considered to be of archaeological interest.
Condition : 28 - To protect the visual amenity of the area.

Condition : 29 - To enable the Council to give consideration to the impact
    of the building works on the surrounding area.

Condition : 30 - & 13. To enable the Council to ensure access to adjoining
    premises is  not prejudiced while the development is
    undertaken.

Condition : 31 - In order to ensure that the full development package,
    including the change of use of the ground floor of
    Dorrington House is completed and occupied as permitted and
    to minimise disruption to existing businesses in Hardwicke
    House.

Condition : 32 - To ensure the permanent retention of the accommodation for
    parking purposes and to ensure that the use of the building
    does not add to traffic congestion.

Condition : 33 - To avoid obstruction of the surrounding streets and to
    safeguard amenities of adjacent premises.

Condition : 34 - To ensure the development is completed and occupied in
    accordance with the intentions of the proposed scheme.

Condition : 35 - In order that the Council may give consideration to this
    aspect of the scheme which is not considered satisfactory
    on the drawings which form part of the submission.

Condition : 36 - Your attention is drawn to the requirements of Sections 4,
    7, and 8A of the Chronically Sick & Disabled Persons Act
    1970 that this development (for employment use or to which
    the public will be admitted) should be made accessible to
    disabled people wherever practicable. Guidance is provided
    in British Standards Institution Code of Practice BS 5588
    1987 "Access for the Disabled to Buildings".

Condition : 37 - Noise from demolition and construction works is subject to
    control under The Control of Pollution Act 1974. You are
    advised to consult the Council's Planning, Transport &
    Health Service, Pollution Team, Town Hall, Argyle Street
    entrance, Euston Road, WC1H 8EQ, (tel: 071-278 4444), or to
    seek prior approval under Section 61 if you anticipate any
    difficulty in carrying out construction other than within
    normal working hours and by means that would minimise
    disturbance to adjoining premises.

Condition : 38 - Works of construction and ancillary activity should not
    take place other than between the hours of 8am to 6pm on
    Monday to Friday and 8am to 1pm on Saturday, with no
    working on Sunday or Bank Holidays, in order to comply with
    locally enforced standards.

Condition : 39 - In good time prior to the start of construction (or, if
    appropriate, demolition) on site the contractor shall
    discuss and agree with the Council's Traffic Management
    Section (tel. 071 860 5629) detailed arrangements for the
    transportation of goods and materials to and from the site.
    The Council will prosecute those responsible for any
    breaches of the provisions of the Highways and Litter Acts
    which occur as a result of construction on the site.
